intro: Taravalia, commonly known as the African violet. It is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, velvety flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Taravalia is also known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
